meanings.definition: To shine brighter or more brightly than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sun was outgleaming the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile outgleamed all the other smiles in the room.
meanings.sent3: The little firefly thought it was outgleaming the moon, much to the moon's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The diamond outgleamed all the other gems in the jewelry store.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse outgleamed the city lights, guiding ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: The act of shining brighter or more brightly than something else.
meanings.sent1: The outgleaming of the lighthouse could be seen from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The outgleaming of the diamond caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The outgleaming of the firefly in the dark forest was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The outgleaming of the sun on the water created a dazzling reflection.
meanings.sent5: The outgleaming of her eyes revealed her excitement and joy.
